TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
DATE , the applicant was detained in a cell at ORG , where he was beaten by police officers , who forced him to confess to the murder of a certain Mr Z.

On DATE the NORP ORG of GPE sentenced the police officers concerned to imprisonment for an aggravated abuse of power . The court also awarded the applicant a total of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL against the officers in moral damages .

In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against ORG claiming compensation for material and moral damage suffered as the result of the ill - treatment . On DATE the ORG partly allowed this claim , ordering ORG to pay the applicant a total of ORG CARDINAL in compensation for material damage . The court , however , rejected the claim for moral suffering as it had already been redressed by the award against the convicted officers in the criminal proceedings . The applicant appealed against the latter finding . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal under the cassation procedure .
On DATE the GPE ORG instituted enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

According to a letter of ORG of DATE , the enforcement proceedings were impeded by the lack of budgetary funds earmarked for such purposes . Nevertheless , from DATE the applicant received from the debtor DATE instalments of UAH CARDINAL . Thus , by DATE , when the enforcement proceedings were formally terminated , the applicant had been repaid the full amount of the award ( the last payment of ORG CARDINAL being made on DATE ) .

The relevant domestic law is set out in the judgments of DATE in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . PERSON , § § CARDINAL ) and of CARDINAL DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE ) .
According to LAW , the first instance judgment becomes final upon the expiry of the time limit for appeal or , if an appeal is lodged , after the examination of the case by the appellate court .
